title: Feds arrest 171 suspected members of drug cartel in New England, including 49 in Mass.
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: The DEA arrested 171 suspected members of the Sinaloa Cartel in New England in August, including 49 in Massachusetts.
Agents seized $1.3 million in currency, 33 guns, and 244 kilograms of drugs in New England.
Between August 25-29, DEA arrested 617 suspects nationwide, seizing over $11 million and numerous drugs and firearms.

title: Holidays not on the “calendar”
author: Pattie Hunt Sinacole
bullets: Floating holidays allow employees to take time off for personal or cultural celebrations not on the company holiday schedule.
Typically, employees must request floating holidays in advance, with approval often required from a supervisor.
Full-time employees are usually paid for floating holidays, whereas part-time employees may not receive pay.

title: Stefon Diggs talked about his Patriots debut, and the respect he has for Mike Vrabel
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Stefon Diggs made his Patriots debut in a 20-13 loss to the Raiders, recording six catches for 57 yards.
Diggs reflected on his performance and ongoing recovery from a 2024 ACL injury, feeling 'decent' to be back.
Diggs praised Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel, expressing respect for his leadership as both a player and coach.

title: Readers: What’s your favorite spot for apple picking?
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Boston.com seeks reader input to update its guide to the best apple orchards in Massachusetts for 2025.
Honey Pot Hill Orchards was voted favorite by Boston.com readers in 2023; new contenders are sought for 2025.
Hollis Hills Farms and Red Apple Farm were named among USA Today's top U.S. apple orchards.

title: Photos: Highlights from Day 2 at Seisiún Irish music festival in Boston
author: Boston.com
bullets: The Seisiún Irish music festival continued at Suffolk Downs, overcoming rain with lively performances from multiple bands.
The Waterboys, Glen Hansard, The Pogues, and Just Mustard performed on Day 2 of the festival.
Fans stayed undeterred by the rain, enjoying sets from various artists, including a closing performance by The Pogues.

title: Mike Vrabel on Drake Maye, Will Campbell, and Bill Belichick’s comments about banning Patriots scouts
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Mike Vrabel critiques Patriots' lack of complementary football in 20-13 loss to Raiders in season opener.
Vrabel discusses quarterback Drake Maye's performance, emphasizing need for balanced play and improved response to mistakes.
Vrabel addresses rookie Will Campbell's play and Belichick's ban on Patriots scouts from UNC campus.

title: Court puts reinstatement of cannabis commission head on hold
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A Massachusetts judge ruled to reinstate Shannon O'Brien as Cannabis Control Commission chair, citing wrongful termination.
The state, led by Treasurer Deborah Goldberg, filed an appeal to delay O'Brien's reinstatement for a week.
O'Brien's legal team must respond by Wednesday before a judge rules on the state's appeal against her reinstatement.

title: Man charged with murder after woman, 38, found dead in Lynn, DA says
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: A 38-year-old woman was found dead on Newhall Street in Lynn early Sunday morning.
A 30-year-old Lynn man was arrested and charged with murder, according to the Essex County District Attorney.
The suspect is scheduled to be arraigned in Lynn District Court on Monday morning.

title: Jakobi Meyers shuts down questions about trade request: ‘Happy to be a Raider’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers remains with the Raiders despite requesting a trade over contract issues; the team denied the request.
Meyers had eight receptions for 97 yards against his former team, New England Patriots, in a 20-13 victory.
The Patriots have seen significant changes, now under coach Mike Vrabel, after releasing Bill Belichick and Jerod Mayo.

title: Tornado confirmed in Mass. town as powerful storm sweeps over region
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A tornado was confirmed in Holden, Mass., with damage reported; a survey of its impact is pending.
Severe thunderstorms affected the East Coast, placing Massachusetts under a watch for tornadoes, hail, and strong winds.
Fallen trees and debris caused power outages and road blockages in Paxton and Holyoke, but no injuries were reported.
